str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
Nor, neither, not even, neither?nor. From me and te; not too, i.e. neither or nor; also, not even.
The sun, sunlight. From hele; the sun; by implication, light.
Nor, neither, not even, neither?nor. From me and te; not too, i.e. neither or nor; also, not even.
A star. Neuter from aster; properly, a constellation; put for a single star.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Genitive Neuter Plural
str2: From epi and phaino; to shine upon, i.e. Become visible or known.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
Or neuter pleion, or pleon comparative of polus; more in quantity, number, or quality; also the major portion.
A day, the period from sunrise to sunset.
And, both. A primary particle of connection or addition; both or also.
From a derivative of cheo, meaning a storm; by implication, the rainy season, i.e. Winter.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Genitive Masculine Singular
str2: From epi and keimai; to rest upon.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From peri and haireomai; to remove all around, i.e. Unveil, cast off; figuratively, to expiate.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
Hope, expectation, trust, confidence. From a primary elpo; expectation or confidence.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Verb - Present Infinitive Middle or Passive
str2: To save, heal, preserve, rescue. From a primary sos; to save, i.e. Deliver or protect.
